Detailed Description

AbstractModuleApi.h provides a generic interface or hardware abstraction layer to control many aspects of most modules.The goal is provide a method to write generic control code which can be run on different platforms. All control strategies included in the ASE library uses only this interface to access the modules.

Author:
David Johan Christensen, Modular Robotics Lab, University of Southern Denmark
Note:
This software is distributed under the BSD open-source license.

Function Documentation

float getActuatorPosition ( int  actuator  ) 

Get the current position (scaled 0.0-1.0) of the actuator with an index (0, 1, 2,...)

int getHardwareID (  ) 

Returns the modules hardware ID. Note that for some system it might not always be present or it might not be globally unique.

long getLocalMsTime (  ) 

Get the time in milliseconds since the module was started

float getLocalTime (  ) 

Get the time in seconds since the module was started

int getNumberOfActuators (  ) 

Returns the number of actuators on the module.

int getNumberOfNeighborChannels (  ) 

Returns the number of "local" channels. Neighbor channels can be assumed to run from 0 to getNumberOfNeighborChannels()-1.

long getRandomSeed (  ) 

Get a random number seed, which is not the same on every module

int hasNeighbor ( int  channel  ) 

Returns if a modules can communication with another module using a given channel. The type of returns can be: 0-no other, 1-yes (one or several other modules), 2-undefined (e.g. channel does not exist or it is impossible for the module to know).

int sendMessageToAllExcept ( char *  msg,
char  length,
char  except 
)

Send a message to all neighbor module(s) except one on a given channel. Returns the number of messages send.

int sendMessageToAllNeighbors ( char *  msg,
int  length 
)

Send a message to all neighbor modules. Returns the number of messages send.

int sendMessageToNeighbor ( char *  msg,
int  length,
int  channel 
)

Send a message to neighbor module(s) on a given channel. Returns the number of messages send.

int setActuatorPosition ( float  position,
int  actuator 
)

Set the target position (scaled 0.0-1.0) of the actuator with an index (0, 1, 2,...) returns 1 if successful
